nl.inl.blacklab.indexers.config

Class DocIndexerConfig

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.inl.blacklab.index.DocIndexer
      • nl.inl.blacklab.indexers.config.DocIndexerBase
        • nl.inl.blacklab.indexers.config.DocIndexerConfig
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AutoCloseable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DocIndexerChat, DocIndexerConvertAndTag, DocIndexerPlainText, DocIndexerSaxon, DocIndexerTabular, DocIndexerXPath

    public abstract class DocIndexerConfig
extends DocIndexerBase
    A DocIndexer configured using a ConfigInputFormat structure.

      • optTranslateFieldName

        protected String optTranslateFieldName(String from)
        Description copied from class: DocIndexer
        Translate a field name before adding it to the Lucene document. By default, simply returns the input. May be overridden to change the name of a metadata field as it is indexed.
        Overrides:
        optTranslateFieldName in class DocIndexer
        Parameters:
        from - original metadata field name
        Returns:
        new name

           throws IOException,
                  MalformedInputFile,
                  PluginException
        Description copied from class: DocIndexer
        Index documents contained in a file.
        Specified by:
        index in class DocIndexer
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurred
        MalformedInputFile - if the input file wasn't valid
        PluginException - if an error occurred in a plugin

      • indexSpecificDocument

        public void indexSpecificDocument(String documentExpr)
        Description copied from class: DocIndexerBase
        Index a specific document. Only supported by DocIndexerBase.
        Specified by:
        indexSpecificDocument in class DocIndexerBase
        Parameters:
        documentExpr - Expression (e.g. XPath) used to find the document to index in the file

        protected void processLinkedDocument(ConfigLinkedDocument ld,
                                     Function<String,String> xpathProcessor)
        process linked documents when configured. An xPath processor can be provided, it will retrieve information from the document to construct a path to a linked document.
        Parameters:
        ld -
        xpathProcessor -

      • processMetadataValue

        protected String processMetadataValue(String name,
                                      String value)
        If any processing steps were defined for this metadata field, apply them now. This is used for non-XML formats, where we don't actively seek out the metadata but encounter it as we go.
        Parameters:
        name - metadata field name
        value - metadata field value
        Returns:
        processed value (or orifinal value if not found / no processing steps defined)
